conclusion: Determine the magnitude of the electrostatic force on point charge q between capacitor plates.
Electric field E in a parallel-plate capacitor is uniform and given by E = V/d.
Potential difference V is expressed as V = Q/C.
Substitute V = Q/C into E = V/d to get E = Q/(Cd).
Force F on point charge q in electric field E is F = qE.
Substitute E = Q/(Cd) into F = qE to get F = q(Q/(Cd)).
The magnitude of the electrostatic force is F = qQ/(Cd).
